title: How to Make Apple Shortcake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Line the baking pan with baking paper.

steps.headline: Sift the dry ingredients into a bowl.
Rub the butter into the dry ingredients with cold fingertips.
Add the milk or water and egg (or replacement).
steps.description: Mix until a soft batter forms.

steps.headline: Divide the mixture into two.
steps.description: Pour the first half of the batter into the baking pan.

steps.headline: Gently cover the mixture with the drained stewed apples.
Pour the remaining half of the batter over the top of the stewed apples.
steps.description: Smooth the mixture to the edges using a spatula.

steps.headline: Place in the oven and bake for 30 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean.
Allow to cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Gently slide onto a wire cooling rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve with whipped cream, ice cream or fresh slices of apples or an apple and berry compote.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Line the baking pan with baking paper. Sift the dry ingredients into a bowl.  Rub the butter into the dry ingredients with cold fingertips.  Add the milk or water and egg (or replacement). Mix until a soft batter forms. Divide the mixture into two. Pour the first half of the batter into the baking pan. Gently cover the mixture with the drained stewed apples.  Pour the remaining half of the batter over the top of the stewed apples. Smooth the mixture to the edges using a spatula. Place in the oven and bake for 30 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean.  Allow to cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Gently slide onto a wire cooling rack to cool completely. Serve. Serve with whipped cream, ice cream or fresh slices of apples or an apple and berry compote.
